originalTitle: Planned US-funded baby vaccine trial in Guinea-Bissau blasted by WHO
title: Planned US-funded baby vaccine trial in Guinea-Bissau blasted by WHO
content: Giving some newborns in Guinea-Bissau an established hepatitis B treatment but not others is "unethical", it says.

originalTitle: Kenyans drop flowers for Valentine's bouquets of cash. Not everyone is impressed
title: Wow! Money Flowers in Kenya!
content:
Hello, amazing friends! I'm your special kid-friendly news reporter, here from beautiful Africa! Today, we have a super interesting story from a country called Kenya. It's in East Africa, and it's full of sunshine and friendly people!

What Are These Special Flowers?

Imagine a bunch of beautiful flowers, but guess what? They are not made of petals! They are made of real money! Yes, real money, folded up super carefully to look like roses or other lovely flowers. People call these "cash bouquets" or "money flowers." Isn't that wild? These amazing money flowers are real banknotes folded into pretty shapes. They can be given for birthdays, weddings, or special days like Valentine's Day.

Why Are They So Popular?

These money flowers have become very, very popular in Kenya, especially around special days like Valentine's Day. Valentine's Day is a day when people show love to their friends and family. They give gifts to say "I love you!" or "You are special!" Instead of regular flowers or chocolates, some people started giving these amazing money bouquets. It's a new and exciting way to show you care. Did you know? Kenya is famous for its amazing wildlife, like lions, elephants, and giraffes! It's a land of adventure! It's like getting a gift that is also super useful! You can use the money to buy anything you need or want. Some people think it's a very creative and fun way to give a gift. It's a big surprise! Imagine opening a gift and finding money folded into pretty shapes! Wow! It makes receiving a gift very special and unique.

How Are They Made?

Crafty people fold paper money very gently. They make it look like petals and leaves. They use different kinds of money, like big notes or small notes, to make the bouquet colourful. Then, they put these money flowers together with ribbons and pretty wrapping paper. It looks just like a real flower bouquet, but full of banknotes! It must take a lot of patience to make them. Each money flower is a little artwork!

Valentine's Day Fun!

On Valentine's Day, people want to give the best gifts. Some people think a money bouquet is the best because it's new and exciting. It's a big splash! It shows someone you really thought about them and wanted to give them something very special. But, guess what? Not everyone thinks these money flowers are the very best idea. Some grown-ups have started to think about the rules. Did you know? Valentine's Day is celebrated on February 14th every year! It's a day for hearts and hugs!

What's The Worry?

Some grown-ups are a little bit worried about these money bouquets. They are worried because it means carrying around a lot of real money. Carrying too much money can sometimes be a bit risky. It's safer to keep most of your money in a bank, where it's protected. If you have a lot of money in your pocket, someone might try to take it, and we don't want that! Another reason for worry is about "money rules." Banks and governments like to know where big amounts of money come from and where they go. When people give very big money bouquets, it can be hard to keep track of all that money. It's like when you have a piggy bank, your parents usually know how much is inside, right? It helps to keep things organised.

Why Are Money Rules Important?

Money rules help keep everyone safe and make sure things are fair. It helps stop people from doing bad things with money, like getting money from unfair places. So, when a lot of money is just passed around in big bouquets, it can make it harder for the rules to work. It's important for big money gifts to be clear and easy to understand for everyone. It helps the whole country's money system stay strong. Did you know? The smallest amount of money in Kenya is called a 'shilling'! Just like some other countries have cents or pence! Some people also think that gifts should be about love and thought, not just how much money you spend. A small, thoughtful gift made with love can be just as special, or even more special, than a big money gift. It's about the feeling, not just the value. What do you think? Is a handmade card better than lots of money? Maybe both are good if they come from the heart!

What Other Gifts Can We Give?

There are so many wonderful ways to show someone you care! You can give a bunch of real, sweet-smelling flowers. They are so pretty and smell lovely! You can give yummy chocolates or a delicious cake. Everyone loves a sweet treat! Or you can make a super special card with drawings and glitter. Handmade gifts are full of love and show you spent time thinking. A lovely drawing, a special song, or even just a big hug can be the best gift of all. It shows you put your heart into it, and that's what truly matters on a day like Valentine's. So, while money flowers are very interesting, there are many other ways to show love. Think about what your friend would truly enjoy! Did you know? The most popular flowers given on Valentine's Day are red roses! They stand for deep love and affection!

What Does This Mean for the Future?

So, what will happen to these money flowers in Kenya? Well, people might start thinking a bit more about how they give money gifts. They might still give money, but maybe in a different, safer way, like putting it neatly in an envelope. Or they might send it directly to a bank account, which is super safe! The most important thing is to always be safe and smart with money. That keeps everyone happy and secure.

Remember What Matters Most!

Giving gifts is a wonderful way to show love and appreciation to your loved ones. Whether it's a money flower, a real flower, or a handmade card, the love behind the gift is the most important part. And always remember to be smart and safe when it comes to money. Keep it safe in the bank! That's all from your African news reporter today! See you next time for more amazing stories from our amazing continent! Bye for now!
summary: People in Kenya have been giving special gifts of money folded like flowers, but grown-ups are now sharing some important warnings about carrying lots of cash.
whyMatters: It matters because it helps us learn to be creative with gifts, but also to be very careful and smart about how we handle money, keeping it safe and following the rules.
